Non-smooth
 Optimization

Research interests

My research interests include the follwing main aspects

  • Convergence rate of first-order methods
  • Acceleration of first-order methods
  • Stochastic optimization
  • Imaging problem and data science

Convergence rate of first-order methods

I started my research career in 2010 with master study at the Department of Mathematics at Shanghai Jiao Tong University China, where I worked on mathematical image processing. I published three papers on image reconstruction and enhancement.

I began my PhD from 2013, which was funded by the ERC starting grant $\Sigma$-Vision. My PhD work mainly focused on convergence rate analysis of first-order operator splitting methods which are widely used in, for instance, image processing, inverse problems, statistics and machine learning.

  • My first PhD project was studying the convergence rates of generic \KM fixed-point iteration, which covered various previous results as special cases. The result was published in Mathematical Programming which is one of the leading journals in optimisation and operation research.

  • The major contribution of my PhD work is a unified framework for analysing the local linear convergence of first-order methods for non-smooth optimisation, which is the first time in the literature, despite local linear convergence phenomena having been observed for decades. The obtained results were published in top journals including SIAM Journal on Optimization and leading machine learning conferences including Neural Information Processing System (NIPS) and International Conference on Machine Learning (ICML).

After joining Cambridge Image Analysis group from 2017, I began to work on the geometric perspective of non-smooth optimisation and beyond, which provides a better understanding of the problems arising from non-smooth optimisation and other related fields including set-valued analysis, control theory and operation research. In turn, it impacts both algorithm design and related research areas such as sensitivity analysis and optimal control.

I am also working on analysing existing acceleration techniques, in particular the inertial technique. For this direction, I am collaborating with people from Cambridge and outside the UK (China, France and the US) to design problem oriented acceleration schemes.

References

  1. Screening for Sparse Online Learning: J. Liang and C. Poon, 2021.
  2. The Fun is Finite: Douglas--Rachford and Sudoku Puzzle --- Finite Termination and Local Linear Convergence: R. Tovey and J. Liang, 2020.
  3. Convergence Rates of Forward–Douglas–Rachford Splitting Method: C. Molinari, J. Liang and J. Fadili, Journal of Optimization Theory and Applications, 182(2):606-639, 2019.
  4. Partial Smoothness and Constant Rank: A. Lewis, J. Liang, 2019.
  5. Local Convergence Properties of SAGA/Prox-SVRG and Acceleration: C. Poon, J. Liang and C. Schönlieb, ICML, 2018.
  6. Local Linear Convergence Analysis of Primal–Dual Splitting Methods: J. Liang, J. Fadili and G. Peyré, Optimization, 67(6):821-853, 2018.
  7. Activity Identification and Local Linear Convergence of Forward-Backward-type methods: J. Liang, J. Fadili and G. Peyré, SIAM Journal on Optimization, 27(1):408-437, 2017.
  8. Local Convergence Properties of Douglas–Rachford and Alternating Direction Method of Multipliers: J. Liang, J. Fadili and G. Peyré, Journal of Optimization Theory and Applications, 172(3):874-913, 2017.
  9. Convergence Rates with Inexact Nonexpansive Operators: J. Liang, J. Fadili and G. Peyré, Mathematical Programming, 59(1):403-434, 2016.
  10. Activity Identification and Local Linear Convergence of Douglas-Rachford\/ADMM under Partial Smoothness: J. Liang, J. Fadili, G. Peyré and R. Luke, SSVM, 2015.
  11. Local Linear Convergence of Forward-Backward under Partial Smoothness: J. Liang, J. Fadili and G. Peyré, NeurIPS, 2014.
  12. On the Convergence Rates of Proximal Splitting Algorithms: J. Liang, J. Fadili and G. Peyré, ICIP, 2014.

Acceleration of first-order methods

References

  1. Geometry of First-order Methods and Adaptive Acceleration: C. Poon and J. Liang, , 2020.
  2. Trajectory of Alternating Direction Method of Multipliers and Adaptive Acceleration: C. Poon, J. Liang, NeurIPS, 2019.
  3. Improving “Fast Iterative Shrinkage-Thresholding Algorithm”: Faster, Smarter and Greedier: J. Liang, T. Luo and C. Schönlieb, , 2019.
  4. Faster FISTA: J. Liang, C. Schönlieb, EUSIPCO, 2018.
  5. A Multi-step Inertial Forward-Backward Splitting Method for Non-convex Optimization: J. Liang, J. Fadili and G. Peyré, NeurIPS, 2016.

Stochastic optimization

References

  1. A Stochastic Alternating Direction Method of Multipliers for Non-smooth and Non-convex Optimization: F. Bian, J. Liang and X. Zhang, Inverse Problems, 2021.
  2. SPRING: A Fast Stochastic Proximal Alternating Method for Non-smooth Non-convex Optimization: D. Driggs, J. Tang, J. Liang, M. Davies and C. Schönlieb, , 2020.
  3. On the Bias-Variance Tradeoff in Stochastic Gradient Methods: D. Driggs, J. Liang and C. Schönlieb, , 2019.

Imaging problem and data science

References

  1. A Fast and Adaptive SVD-free Algorithm for General Weighted Low-rank Recovery: A. Dutta, J. Liang and X. Li, , 2021.
  2. Tuning-free Plug-and-Play Proximal Algorithm for Inverse Imaging Problems: K. Wei, A. Aviles-Rivero, J. Liang, Y. Fu, C. Schönlieb and H. Huang, ICML, 2020.
  3. Best Pair Formulation & Accelerated Scheme for Non-convex Principal Component Pursuit: A. Dutta, F. Hanzely, J. Liang and P. Richtárik, IEEE Trans. on Signal Processing, 2020.
  4. Retinex by Higher order Total Variation \(L^1\) Decomposition: J. Liang, X. Zhang, Journal of Mathematical Imaging and Vision, 52(3):345-355, 2015.
  5. Seismic Data Restoration via Data-driven Framelet: J. Liang, J. Ma and X. Zhang, Geophysics, 79(3):65-74, 2014.
  6. Wavelet Frame based Color Image Demosaicing: J. Liang, J. Li, Z. Shen and X. Zhang, Inverse Problems and Imaging, 7(3):777-794, 2013.
